document_data.name: Fastidious Fungi
document_data.author: [[J. L. Corrins]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Fastidious Fungi''''' was a [[book]] penned by [[J. L. Corrins]] and published sometime in or before the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Content: ''Fastidious Fungi'' included some information on [[hag]]s, presumably the [[pearlspore bell]] [[mushroom]]s that could be used to return a slain hag to the land of the living. However, that lore was thought to be pure speculation by some.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, a copy of ''Fastidious Fungi'' was studied by [[Mayrina]] after forming the [[Anti-Hag Support Group]], in search of ways to stop hags' sinister and malicious plots.
